name: Grand Paradise Playa Dorada

reviews.title: WORRIED ABOUT SEWAGE OUTFLOW.
reviews.text: I did not stay at this hotel (I was at the adjacent Gran Ventana (see review) next along the beach to the East). However, I did walk along the beach outside the Paradise Beach Club and was very concerned to see an array of effluent pipes built into the sea wall, discharging a trickle of very noxious petroleum-based liquid directly onto the sand and into the sea (you could see the irridescent colours on the surface of the sand and the water). Although it was only a gentle trickle, the overpowering smell was very evident for quite a distance either side of the pipes, and made me feel nauseous for half an hour or so. I cannot comment otherwise on the Paradise Beach Club, but I would be very wary about spending any time on the beach or in the sea in that area.

reviews.title: Good place for grad trip
reviews.text: Got back yesterday, and all-in-all, a perfect place for 120 kids to spend a week together. Would never recommend this place to families or married couples, but that is my style. Rooms were OK, a little confusing to find your way in the dark (and after a few drinks). There was no hot water at times too, and no shampoo either. Drinks were really strong, the buffet got better as the week progressed, but we really liked Eden's restaurant. The casino was pretty ghetto too, not so sure that games aren't rigged, but we had fun anyways. Crazy moon was pretty crazy too, but make sure you pay using pesos or else they'll rip you off if you use American. And what's with the one key per room policy? Worst idea ever. Oh, one final thing, those d*** helicopters every morning early drove me crazy. But hey, a great trip...at a 3 star, not 4 star hotel.

reviews.title: Nice time
reviews.text: Nice place. We enjoyed a nice relaxing week in November. Food was plentiful. Drinks were strong. Staff was friendly. The only issue was the lack of shampoo in the room. We swam, rode horses, biked and played tennis. Not a top of the line resort, but comfortable.

reviews.title: a great place to stay
reviews.text: We were at the resort from January 17th - 24th. The weather was nice and hot, it rained 1 day that we were there. The staff at the hotel were amazing, they were so polite and very concerned about our enjoyment. The food was good. I mean if you go away you have to expect that your not going to get the food your used to at home but all and all the a la cart resaurants were great and the buffet had a lot of variety so there was always something you could eat. Just don't go to dinner to late or your selection will decrease. The animation team did their best consiering they seamed to be working on a low budget. The pool and the hotel facilities were well kept. We went on the horse back riding on the hotel bus. It was an interesting experience for someone who had never went. The disco played a lot of spanish music on the wednesday but it also played hip hip like 50 cent. On friday we went for a couple minutes when they were playing rock but we didn't stay bc we were leaving early the next day. For shopping go to the plaza down the street first to get an idea of prices, even after bargaining for ever it is hard to get a good deal on the beach. The beach was beautiful as well. You can get some really good deals on selloffvacations or sunholidays if your traveling last minute check it out! All and all it is a good place to stay so check it out.

reviews.title: Nice resort, now a bit run down
reviews.text: Paradise is a very nice resort that has been allowed to go a bit to seed. Good points:The beach is lovely and the pool is nice. Food is varied and tasty. Staff is friendly and helpful.Really bad point:There are some really bad rooms, like the one we got when we arrived late on our first day. It was literally just above the outdoor poolside stage and thus very noisy. It was dingy and the bathroom, while functional was quite gross.Less good:The second room we got was a lot nicer. It was quieter with a view of the ocean. But it was still tired looking.

reviews.title: Buyer beware!!!!!
reviews.text: Paradise Casino and Resort is the furthest thing from Paradise we have ever experienced! Upon arrival, the English speaking clerk at the front desk provided us with our inroom security box key as requested, provided us with a bellboy to assist us with our luggage. We proceeded through the "confused" complex and up four flights of rounding stairs to "our room" -- in the ATTIC that is! As the bellboy opened the door to our room, my girlfriend SCREAMED at what she saw. An "extremely" narrow spiral staircase (90 degree would be my guess!), running straight up and down and consisted of approximately 3 feet in width! This was the first thing our eyes were set upon -- our noses were offered something altogether different, but just as awful! Had we been larger individuals I would question whether we would have fit in the stairwell at all! Then another door which had clearly been vandalized, as the lock and doorknob were existing by mere shards of wood splinters that remained in the doorframe (or maybe it was just "rotting" off/out of the door???). The room STUNK, it was dark (one lamp for entire room), the air conditioning was "oozing" some black "stuff" and it ran down the wall, not to mention the airvent was hanging out of the wall ready to drop at any moment. Two of the three windows did NOT possess glass -- YES that is correct ... no glass over the windows. So you can well imagine the "fright" we possessed at the sight of the vandalized door and lack of "anything" for window coverings... clearly anthing/anybody could have entered at their leisure! WE booked a standard room with two beds, we got a "closet" in the "attic". We requested to move, front desk clerk could no longer speak English and provided us with "Nueki". Nueki didn't give a hoot and clearly told us "Too bad, that is the room you get!" OUr story is an AWFUL one and long at best, but for anyone planning on the Paradise -- I strongly suggest you AVOID IT LIKE THE PLAGUE!!!! (P.S. There was a seniors group that booked rooms "months" prior -- the Paradise had overbooked and basically they got what they got -- Guess what they got? Four flights and a spiral staircase in the "attic" -- One gentleman was 87 years old, another lady in her 70's fell down the spiral staircase! - no attempt to have them moved!) - Travelled the Carribean, South America and many places for "many" years -- never experienced anything so absolutely horrible!

reviews.title: Not a 4 star resort!
reviews.text: Visited Paradise Beach Resort from Feb17-24, 2004. My initial reaction upon entering the resort was, "This definitely doesn't look like a 4-star resort!" And further investigation proved me right. Our room was substandard, the bedspreads had holes in them, the sheets were threadbare and one of the beds had hair on the sheets, the air-conditioning wasn't working properly, and the bathroom needed a major facelift. This resort is in disrepair, it seems to have had no upkeep and it is showing everywhere you look. Paint is peeling off of walls, furniture is old and rickety, and it just wasn't an endearing place to be. The main buffet restaurant has all plastic chairs and tables, not what you would expect in a 4 star. The food was good however, and the service for the most part was also good. One thing that definitely needs improving is the seating capacity of the restaurant. At the busiest meal of the day (dinner) you would be walking around with your plate full of food and no where to sit! It seemed as though the resort couldn't handle the numbers. If you were lucky enough to find an empty table, it more often than not wasn't set, so you were off and running about looking for cutlery, napkins and the like. And to top it all off, there were 3 stray cats that wandered the dining area on a regular basis, looking to be fed. Some patrons didnt find this offensive, but I certainly did. I am not an animal lover, nor do I expect that I should be subjected to a cat rubbing up against my leg while I am trying to have a meal! Some people obviously didnt mind it, cause they were feeding the creatures food from their plates! The people working at the resort didn't try to shoo the animals away, so obviously it was okay with them. The best part of the place was the bartender Alan...........and his expertise at serving drinks with quite a flair. That in itself was entertaining. Speaking of entertainment, the nightly shows are a farce! Compared to the shows I have seen at other resorts, this place was laughable. One in particular, the Diva show, was sad and demeaning to women. All in all, I didn't have the vacation that I had hoped for. I definitely would not return to this resort, nor would I recommend it to others. I would rate this palce as a 3-star.....and that would be a stretch.

reviews.title: Loved everything!!
reviews.text: Just got back from Puerta Plata, went for 2 weeks, from 8th Feb 04 - 22 Feb 04. It is amazing out there. Beautiful beaches and scenery. Paradise Beach Hotel was excellent. The room was simple, but clean and spacious. The food was lovely, loads of variety and different theme nights. Hemingways in the Plaza was also a great place to eat american style food. All the staff were lovely, helpful and always happy and cheerful. You must definately go to Ocean World, we did the dolphin encounter, it was amazing being so close to the dolphins, dancing with them and kissing them. You can also do the dolphin swim, but i felt the encounter was much better and cheaper. Also, you must visit Paradise Island. The journey on the coach is a bit of a pain, but it is well worth it. You travel on a speedboat over to the island and prepare to be amazed when you get there. It is beautiful, golden sand, clear water and loads of fish which you can see through the water or you can snorkel. The monster Truck safari was a good trip. It was very interesting to see how the dominican people live, but also quite sad to see the children. Make sure you take some sweets to give to them. I do feel the trip was a bit over - rated though. Overall the holiday was brilliant. Both me and my boyfriend really enjoyed it and we didnt want to come home. Id definately go back there!!!

reviews.title: The best hotel in DOM DOM
reviews.text: Me and my best friend decided on Puerto Plata for our vacation this time and it was amazing!! We were initially a bit worried as the resort boasted an older crowd, and a lot of europeans. But we ended up meeting some really fun people from New York who knew how to have a good time..... Thank God!! I would have to say that this hotel was the best one in the domenican. Just to sit by the beach under a palm tree, listening to the crashing waves and enjoying my breakfast and eating dinner under the stars in the evening was breathtaking!! The food was great, the staff was incredible and the bar tenders would serenade us every nite which was sweet. The Crazy Moon club was a lot of fun, although the music was almost all salsa, but there are plenty of volunteers who will teach you a few moves. You will absolutely enjoy this place and come back with fond memories of the Domenican Republic!! I know we did...

reviews.title: Life is different here
reviews.text: Paridise Beach Club and Casino is different but some what fun. Beautiful beaches food ok Very friendly staff. Rooms are musky but staff found us one that wasn't that bad.

reviews.title: Definite 5 Star
reviews.text: I just got back from Paradise Beach Club on March 4th, 2004. I absolutely love the resort. The people who work there are extremely friendly and helpful. The weather is beautiful, as is the beach. The rooms are nice and well-kept. This was my second time here, and it is even better this time than it was the first. An excellent choice!

reviews.title: Had a fantastic vacation!
reviews.text: After reading some of the reports (after booking of coarse) I was very leary of what the rooms would be like but they were not bad at all.

reviews.title: We'd go back!!
reviews.text: Upon arrival we were told they were overbooked and were given a loft room which you accessed by a narrow spiral staircase. It didn't really bother us but older people could have trouble with it. Also no elevator so had to walk the 4 levels (again a complaint of older people). The room wasn't great but clean and the air conditioner worked. The next day we asked nicely about another room and were told because we were nice and polite we would be given another the next day. Anyone who got loud or nasty did not have such good luck so it pays to be polite. We were given a very nice two floor suite right on the beach and thoroughly enjoyed the rest of our stay. Great beach for walking or relaxing, very good food both at the buffet and in the restaurants. The staff were great and very friendly and helpful and the place was constantly being washed and disinfected. For the money we thought it was great. Lots of Canadians there and not a real young crowd so no need to feel self-conscious on the beach. Not a place for single under 25's looking to meet someone -mostly couples and hardly any children.

reviews.title: Had a Blast!
reviews.text: We just returned and had the most relaxing vacation ever. Unfortunately there are hassles getting a good room because it seems they are always "overbooked" and start you off in an economy "loft" room. It was clean and the air conditioner worked so not a real problem for us but lots of older people couldn't do it as there is a narrow spiral staircase up to the room. Also no elevator so have to climb the four floors. After two days in that room we were upgraded to a beautiful two floor suite right on the ocean. We loved it but I wonder who didn't get the room they were booked for. My only real complaint is that the beds were very hard and only have a choice of twin or double. The food was excellent both on the buffet or in the restaurants. Service was great and the staff very friendly. The drinks were "potent", definitly not watered down like at a lot of all-inclusives. There is a long gorgeous beach to walk or just relax and also a very nice pool. We used the kayaks but didn't try the horseback riding. They are constantly cleaning and the place is very well kept for the age of it. Overall for the price we thought it was great - just don't expect luxury -after all you get what you pay for.

reviews.title: best time of my life!
reviews.text: rooms average, but best shows, best beach, best employees, great food, great tours, makes your whole trip a wonderful experience.

reviews.title: Not a 4-star, more like 2-star
reviews.text: (Sorry for the late review. I only recently discovered TripAdvisor.) We went in March 2003. Because this resort was billed as a 4-star and therefore, our expectations high, my friend and I were very disappointed with our drab accommodations and the quality of the social programs. Our room lacked towels for 2 and everytime we managed to get an extra one, it would disappear the next day if the maid tidied up.

reviews.title: Had a Blast!!!
reviews.text: The a/c was a nuisance - it was so noisy as to disturb one's sleep, and yet if turned off, would leave you so sweaty that you still couldn't sleep. Both my friend and I woke up looking and feeling more haggard than when we went to bed. The food was ordinary. The 2 special dinners were terrible. We had been looking forward to the special nights as an escape from the daily "cafeteria" food, but it was actually worse (Italian cuisine not being a Dominican specialty). The waitstaff are extremely pleasant, however. As for the social activities, many scheduled lessons were canceled with no notice and/or started late because no one knew they were taking place. What was A-1 at this place though was the nightly entertainment. The performers and dancers were outstanding. However, next time, it will be Club Med!

reviews.title: trip to hell and back
reviews.text: Spent a great 2 weeks at the paradise hotel. Just got back and I miss it. The rooms weren't anything great (no weird animals crawling around for 2 weeks), but didn't really matter as I didn't spend much time in the room. You don't really go away to spend time in the hotel room. The food was fantastic and so were the Sonrisa's (my favorite drink) :)....The staff was great and the animation team always kept us busy and laughing. It was all about wazzzzzzzuuuuuuuupppppppp and Okie Dokie :)...I had amazing company (girls you know who you are) and I would definitely go back!!! The weather was awesome and so are our tans. Must say they do keep the place clean as there always passing the mop with soap and water. Dangerous at times people tend to fall. All in all it was a fantastic vacation and I can't wait to go back!

reviews.title: You get what you pay for!!!
reviews.text: worst place i have ever been in 20 years of traveling rooms are very musty beds are no good bathroom flush did not work half the time front desk staff have a scam going on so you will have to pay them cash for a better room waters allways trying to sell you drugs or hookers for the night cosino is fixed so you can not win food is all right for resort food i say pay 200 dollars more to stay at a 5 star resort this resort should be 2 star p.s. had to wash my shirts and shorts two times to get the musty smell out suite case is still on back deck trying to get smell out after 1 week home still stinks ill will bad mouth this resort to any one who asks me what a waste of 3000.dollars trip to hell and back one week home and i can still smell the room we were in

reviews.title: A little word...
reviews.text: My husband and I have just returned from Paradise Beach (14 March 2004). Overall our holiday was good. Before we travelled to DR, I read this site and was wondering what to expect when we got to the hotel. I suppose because we went open minded, we found everything to be OK. It was not the greatest holiday I have ever had but then again it was not the most expensive holiday I have ever had. After two weeks in this hotel, which we found enjoyable (but I would add others there did not), I have to say it only proves to us that you get what you pay for. The Domincan Republic is the cheapest of all the islands to travel to, and it is this for a reason. Do not expect a four star in DR to be the same as everywhere else. In order to receive four star "luxeries" in the DR you must book a five star hotel!!!

aka: Grand Paradise Playa Dorada Hotel Puerto Plata
